content: Muslims today prostrate by putting their foreheads on the ground. But the Quran says that some ancient people used to prostrate on their chins. Skeptics claim that whoever wrote the Quran made a mistake; prostrations were always made on the foreheads, never on the chins. Today Egyptologists found evidence that ancient priests prostrated on the chins.
These are the priests at the temple performing the pre-dawn prayer; they prostrated on the chins. This was known recently, however this was portrayed in the Quran 1400 years before it was discovered.
Say, “Believe in it, or do not believe.” Those who were given knowledge before it, when it is recited to them, they fall to their chins, prostrating.
content_ar: ١٠٧ قُلْ آمِنُوا بِهِ أَوْ لَا تُؤْمِنُوا ۚ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْعِلْمَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِ إِذَا يُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ يَخِرُّونَ لِلْأَذْقَانِ سُجَّدًا

content: In this verse some ancient people used to prostrate on the chins. Today we know that ancient Egyptians used to prostate on their chins.
How could an illiterate man who lived 1400 years ago have known about prostrations on the chins?
